bhinda.name: Bhinda
bhinda.description: High-yield okra suited to monsoon, winter and summer sowings. Performs best on well‑drained sandy loam soils rich in organic matter with assured drainage.
features: Multiple sowing windows (monsoon, winter, summer)
Early picking begins ~45–60 days after sowing
Uniform, tender pods with good marketability
Responsive to balanced NPK and organic manures
Performs well on well‑drained sandy loams
Recommended interculture and vector management reduce losses
Good transport and shelf life at tender harvest
Suitable for line sowing and raised beds in monsoon

details.growingConditions: Optimum temperature 22–30°C; avoid frost and prolonged waterlogging. Soils: well‑drained sandy loam to loam, pH 6.0–7.5, high organic matter.
details.yieldEstimates: Tender marketable pods from 45–60 DAS with regular picking; yield depends on season and package of practices.
details.packaging: Seed rate: 4–6 kg/ha (line sowing); 8–10 kg/ha (broadcast). Treat seed and ensure proper spacing for uniform stand.

keyPoints: Keep field well drained in monsoon; raised beds recommended.
Start interculture 20–25 DAS and repeat at 15–20 day intervals.
Balanced fertilization and timely irrigation improve pod quality.
Harvest at tender stage for premium price and consumer acceptance.

agronomy.soil: Sandy loam to loam, fertile, well‑drained; avoid waterlogging. Ideal pH 6.0–7.5 with added FYM/compost.
agronomy.irrigation: First irrigation immediately after sowing. Summer: every 5–8 days; winter: every 10–12 days; avoid moisture stress at flowering and pod set.

sowing.preparation: Create fine tilth with 2–3 ploughings; add well‑decomposed FYM. In monsoon, use raised beds/ridges for drainage.
sowing.spacing: Monsoon: 60 × 30 cm; Summer/Winter: 45 × 20 cm (adjust by vigor).

agronomy.harvesting: Begin picking 45–60 DAS depending on season and vigor. Pick at tender stage; avoid over‑mature pods to maintain quality.
agronomy.postCutting: Maintain regular picking intervals (1–2 days) for continuous flush; irrigate and top‑dress as required.
agronomy.fertilizer: Basal (typical): N:P:K = 100:50:50 kg/ha; split nitrogen with top‑dressings based on crop stage and soil test.
agronomy.weedControl: Interculture from 20–25 DAS; maintain weed‑free for first 35–40 days. Mulch or pre‑emergence herbicide as per local recommendation.
agronomy.pestManagement: For whitefly/leafhopper vectors, follow IPM: rouging, yellow sticky traps, recommended insecticides as per local advisories. Manage powdery mildew/leaf spots per extension guidance.

gawar.name: Gawar
gawar.description: Cluster bean adapted to sandy loam to clay loam; tolerant to salinity (pH 7.0–8.5). Suitable for Kharif and irrigated summer cropping.
features: Salinity tolerant; pH 7.0–8.5
Kharif and summer sowings
Seed rate 18–20 kg/ha; spacing 45–60 × 20–30 cm
Rhizobium + fungicide seed treatment improves stand
3–4 irrigations in summer (rainfed in Kharif)
Harvest tender pods from 45–60 DAS

details.growingConditions: Best on sandy loam to clay loam, tolerates mild salinity; pH 7.0–8.5. Warm conditions with assured drainage.
details.yieldEstimates: Frequent picking of tender pods from 45–60 DAS; yield governed by variety and management.
details.packaging: Seed rate: 18–20 kg/ha. Spacing: 45–60 cm between rows; 20–30 cm between plants.

keyPoints: Apply 10–15 t/ha FYM during field preparation.
Basal 20:40:40 NPK kg/ha; adjust by soil test.
First weeding at 20–25 DAS; 1–2 more as needed.

agronomy.soil: Sandy loam to clay loam; salinity tolerant; pH 7–8.5 with good drainage.
agronomy.irrigation: Summer crop: 3–4 irrigations at critical stages (flowering, pod fill). Kharif: mostly rainfed.

sowing.preparation: 2–3 ploughings; incorporate FYM. Treat seed with Rhizobium and Carbendazim 2 g/kg.

agronomy.harvesting: Harvest green tender pods starting 45–60 DAS; pick at 3–4 day intervals.
agronomy.postCutting: Maintain field moisture for continuous pod setting; remove over‑mature pods.
agronomy.fertilizer: Basal 20:40:40 kg/ha N:P:K; apply micronutrients per soil test.
agronomy.weedControl: First weeding 20–25 DAS; keep field weed‑free during early growth.
agronomy.pestManagement: Pod borers: follow recommended molecules (e.g., Indoxacarb/Spinosad as locally advised). Diseases: powdery mildew – Sulphur; bacterial blight – Copper Oxychloride as per label.

choli.name: Choli (Cowpea)
choli.description: Cowpea for vegetable use; performs across Kharif, Rabi (South) and Summer with proper agronomy. Earlier maturity in slightly sandy soils under cool conditions.
features: Multiple seasons: Kharif, Rabi (South India), and Summer
Seed rate: 12–18 kg/ha (grain); 30–35 kg/ha (fodder/green manure)
Spacing: 45–30 × 10–15 cm
Seed treatment: Thiram + Carbendazim; Rhizobium inoculation
5–6 irrigations in summer at 10–15 day intervals
Green pods 45–90 DAS (variety‑dependent)

details.growingConditions: Well‑drained loam to slightly heavy soils; slightly sandy in cool zones for earliness. Two ploughings + planking recommended.
details.yieldEstimates: Vegetable: tender pods 45–90 DAS. Grain: harvest 90–125 DAS at full maturity.
details.packaging: Seed rate pure crop (grain): 12–18 kg/ha; fodder/green manure: 30–35 kg/ha. Spacing rows 45–30 cm × plants 10–15 cm.

keyPoints: Weed‑free up to 25–30 DAS is critical.
Starter dose N (15–20 kg/ha) in poor soils; follow soil test for P & K.
Irrigation priority: flowering → pod fill → vegetative.

agronomy.soil: Loam to slightly heavy; slightly sandy for earlier maturity under cool conditions.
agronomy.irrigation: Summer: 5–6 irrigations at 10–15 day intervals; avoid prolonged waterlogging.

sowing.preparation: Two ploughings; treat seed with Thiram 2 g + Carbendazim 1 g/kg; inoculate with Rhizobium @ 10 g/kg.
timing: Kharif: early June to end of July
sowing.seedRate: 12–18 kg/ha (grain); 30–35 kg/ha (fodder/green manure); summer grain 12–15 kg/ha

agronomy.harvesting: Vegetable: pick green pods 45–90 DAS; Grain: harvest 90–125 DAS, dry and thresh; sun‑dry before storage.
agronomy.postCutting: Maintain moisture after weeding and fertilization; ensure drainage to prevent root issues.
agronomy.fertilizer: Poor soils: starter N 15–20 kg/ha (OC < 0.5%); P2O5 and K2O 50–60 kg/ha as per soil test; FYM 5–10 t/ha.
agronomy.weedControl: Keep weed‑free up to 25–30 DAS; interculture as needed.
agronomy.pestManagement: Pod borer: follow recommended molecules; aphids/leafhopper: spray per local advisory; powdery mildew/leaf spots: use labelled fungicides as recommended.
